comments:
Open com.ibm.ivj.examples.vc.swing.mortgageamortizer.AMortizationS2.java and it
throws several NPEs. Here's the stack trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.util.TypeResolver.resolveType(TypeResolver.java:1520)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.java.EventDecoderHelper.getInnerListener(EventDecoderHelper.java:309)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.java.PropertyChangedInnerStyleHelper.processEvent(PropertyChangedInnerStyleHelper.java:77)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.java.EventDecoderHelper.decode(EventDecoderHelper.java:369)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.java.AbstractEventDecoder.decode(AbstractEventDecoder.java:91)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.model.CodeEventRef.decodeExpression(CodeEventRef.java:142)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.decodeExpression(JavaSourceTranslator.java:680)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.buildCompositionModel(JavaSourceTranslator.java:794)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.decodeDocument(JavaSourceTranslator.java:881)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.core.JavaSourceTranslator.loadModel(JavaSourceTranslator.java:656)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.run(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1412)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

This is the new type resolver which is throwing the NPE. I looked at the code
and what it looks like is that the old resolver was capable of handling NULL
inputs, whereas the new resolver doesnt expect a NULL input. I dont know if the
new resolver should handle NULL inputs as there might be other places in codegen
which hit this problem, but havent surfaced as of yet. 
I could put in a simple NULL check to fix this specific problem, but dont know
if the new type resolver should consider handling null inputs. Rich, could you
please advice on what to do so that this problem can be fixed?
*** Bug 73042 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I checked. That is the only place null can be passed in. It doesn't make sense
for resolveType to accept null. Null is never a valid type and shouldn't be
passed in. So the check should be made in the code.

Releasing class EventDecoderHelper. This class was always checking for
superclass type, in the case of Style 2 this is null (only interfaces), and
hence a NPE follows.
Now that 1.0 is released, marking as verified.
Now that 1.0 is released, marking as closed.
